entry.title: William John Seward Webber (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 4.5-ton marble statue of Queen Victoria (pictured) in Harrogate's Jubilee Memorial was carved by the British sculptor William John Seward Webber?

entry.title: Majestic Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Majestic Theatre, designed for "revues and light operas", has hosted the same musical for the past three decades?

entry.title: Albruna (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Albruna may have been the woman of "superhuman size" who stopped Roman general Drusus's campaign in Germania by prophesying his death?

entry.title: Great Western Trail (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the second edition of the Wild West–themed board game Great Western Trail eliminated "the notion of Native Americans as the invisible enemy"?

entry.title: Damon Severson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Damon Severson scored a goal with 0.4 seconds left in regulation time to help lead Canada men's national ice hockey team to a silver medal?

entry.title: Interstate H-2 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the construction of Interstate H-2 in Hawaii unearthed a chapel built by Italian prisoners of war in the 1940s?

entry.title: October 1980 West Nile campaign (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the October 1980 West Nile campaign, rebels were initially hailed as "liberators", only for them to start looting coffee?

entry.title: William Goebel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that William Goebel was sworn in as Governor of Kentucky a day after being shot?
